title: SoundMind: RL-Incentivized Logic Reasoning for Audio-Language Models
author: Xingjian Diao (Dartmouth College), Chunhui Zhang (Dartmouth College), Keyi Kong (Shandong University), Weiyi Wu (Dartmouth College), Chiyu Ma (Dartmouth College), Zhongyu Ouyang (Dartmouth College), Peijun Qing (Dartmouth College), Soroush Vosoughi (Dartmouth College), Jiang Gui (Dartmouth College)
relevance_why: The paper introduces a novel dataset and a reinforcement learning framework which can help refine audio-language models, directly beneficial for Haohe Liu’s research on audio generation and modeling.
background: The study focuses on enhancing reasoning capabilities in audio-language models, specifically addressing challenges in logical reasoning with audio inputs.
contribution: This paper introduces the Audio Logical Reasoning (ALR) dataset and the SoundMind algorithm to solve the inadequacies in audio reasoning frameworks, achieving state-of-the-art performance in multiple audio reasoning tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often relied on simplistic audio reasoning datasets without robust reasoning integration, limiting effectiveness in real-world reasoning tasks.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by developing a structured dual-modality dataset and a reinforcement learning framework tailored for audio reasoning tasks.

key_innovation: Combines high-quality audio-text annotations with a reinforcement learning algorithm specifically designed for logical reasoning in audio-language contexts.
real_world_impact: This framework can enhance applications in dialogue systems and voice interaction technologies, making them more capable of complex reasoning tasks.
limitations: The paper acknowledges potential improvements in audio generation quality, particularly concerning the Word Error Rate (WER) during synthesis.

new_terms.Audio Logical Reasoning (ALR): **Audio Logical Reasoning (ALR)** is a dataset specifically designed for training models on logic and reasoning tasks using dual-modality audio and text formats.
new_terms.Chain-of-Thought (CoT): **Chain-of-Thought (CoT)** prompting refers to methods that guide models to generate reasoning steps leading to an answer, enhancing their logical reasoning capabilities.

open_sourcing: The code and dataset are available at https://github.com/xid32/SoundMind.
